meanings.definition: Extending or performed in a wide or broad manner.
meanings.sent1: The sweeping view from the top of the hill was breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: She made a sweeping gesture with her arms to indicate the size of the fish she caught.
meanings.sent3: The cat took a sweeping leap from the couch to the table, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: His sweeping statement about the future left us all in awe.
meanings.sent5: The sweeping landscape painted a picture of endless beauty.

meanings.definition: Cleaning or clearing an area with a broom or brush.
meanings.sent1: I will be sweeping the floor before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: She sweeps the porch every morning to keep it tidy.
meanings.sent3: As a prank, he started sweeping the grass in the park, pretending it was dirty.
meanings.sent4: The wind was sweeping the leaves across the yard in a dance.
meanings.sent5: The janitor was sweeping the hallway with quick, efficient movements.

meanings.definition: Moving swiftly or forcefully in a wide arc or motion.
meanings.sent1: The sweeping wind carried the kite high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The car made a sweeping turn around the corner.
meanings.sent3: The sweeping river rushed through the valley, unstoppable.
meanings.sent4: Her sweeping kick knocked the ball out of play.
meanings.sent5: The sweeping motion of the dancer's arms captivated the audience.
